intro: Hieracium subelongatum subsp. muerrense, commonly known as the Mürren hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats at high altitudes. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species.
